nodes.id: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

zh-cn: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

death_place.zh-cn: 沃姆斯普林斯 (佐治亚州)

description.zh-cn: 美国第32任总统，带领美国度过大萧条和第二次世界大战。
description.en: 32nd President of the United States, who led the country through the Great Depression and World War II.

description.zh-cn: 富兰克林·罗斯福的妻子，美国第一夫人。
description.en: Wife of Franklin D. Roosevelt and First Lady of the United States.

description.zh-cn: 美国第26任总统，富兰克林·罗斯福的远房族兄。
description.en: 26th President of the United States and a distant cousin of Franklin D. Roosevelt.

description.zh-cn: 英国首相，二战期间与罗斯福紧密合作。
description.en: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom who worked closely with Roosevelt during World War II.

description.zh-cn: 苏联领导人，二战期间与罗斯福、丘吉尔并称“三巨头”。
description.en: Leader of the Soviet Union, one of the 'Big Three' with Roosevelt and Churchill during World War II.

description.zh-cn: 罗斯福的最后一任副总统，在其逝世后接任总统。
description.en: Roosevelt's final Vice President who succeeded him as President upon his death.

description.zh-cn: 美国第31任总统，在1932年选举中被罗斯福击败。
description.en: 31st President of the United States, defeated by Roosevelt in the 1932 election.

description.zh-cn: 美国第28任总统，任命罗斯福为海军助理部长。
description.en: 28th President of the United States, who appointed Roosevelt as Assistant Secretary of the Navy.

description.zh-cn: 罗斯福前两任的副总统。
description.en: Roosevelt's Vice President for his first two terms.

description.zh-cn: 罗斯福的第三任副总统，曾任农业部长。
description.en: Roosevelt's third-term Vice President and former Secretary of Agriculture.

description.zh-cn: 富兰克林·罗斯福的父亲。
description.en: Father of Franklin D. Roosevelt.

description.zh-cn: 富兰克林·罗斯福的母亲。
description.en: Mother of Franklin D. Roosevelt.

description.zh-cn: 埃莉诺·罗斯福的社交秘书，与富兰克林·罗斯福有婚外情。
description.en: Social secretary to Eleanor Roosevelt and had an affair with Franklin D. Roosevelt.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国领导人，二战期间的盟国领袖之一。
description.en: Leader of the Republic of China, one of the Allied leaders during World War II.

description.zh-cn: 纳粹德国元首，二战轴心国主要领导人。
description.en: Führer of Nazi Germany and a principal leader of the Axis powers during World War II.

description.zh-cn: 罗斯福为应对大萧条而推行的一系列经济计划。
description.en: A series of economic programs enacted by Roosevelt in response to the Great Depression.

description.zh-cn: 一场全球性的军事冲突，罗斯福领导美国加入同盟国参战。
description.en: A global military conflict in which Roosevelt led the United States as part of the Allied powers.

description.zh-cn: 一场严重的全球性经济衰退，是罗斯福新政的背景。
description.en: A severe worldwide economic depression that was the context for Roosevelt's New Deal.

en: List of presidents of the United States

description.zh-cn: 美国国家元首和政府首脑的职位。
description.en: The office of the head of state and head of government of the United States.

description.zh-cn: 美国两大主要政党之一，罗斯福所属政党。
description.en: One of the two major contemporary political parties in the United States, to which Roosevelt belonged.

description.zh-cn: 允许美国向盟国提供军事物资的法案。
description.en: A program under which the United States supplied Allied nations with war material.

nodes.id: 同盟国 (第二次世界大战)

zh-cn: 同盟国 (第二次世界大战)

description.zh-cn: 在第二次世界大战中对抗轴心国的国家联盟。
description.en: The coalition of countries that opposed the Axis powers in World War II.

description.zh-cn: 大日本帝国对美国海军基地的突然袭击，导致美国加入第二次世界大战。
description.en: A surprise military strike by the Empire of Japan against the United States naval base, which led to the U.S. entry into World War II.

description.zh-cn: 罗斯福、丘吉尔和斯大林为商讨战后世界秩序而举行的会议。
description.en: A meeting between Roosevelt, Churchill, and Stalin to discuss the post-war reorganization of the world.

description.zh-cn: 二战后成立的国际组织，罗斯福是其关键推动者。
description.en: An international organization founded after World War II, with Roosevelt as a key driving force.

relationships.source: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福
富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 富兰克林·罗斯福是老詹姆斯·罗斯福的儿子。
description.en: Franklin Roosevelt was the son of James Roosevelt I.

relationships.source: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 富兰克林·罗斯福是萨拉·罗斯福的儿子。
description.en: Franklin Roosevelt was the son of Sara Roosevelt.

relationships.source: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 富兰克林·罗斯福是狄奥多·罗斯福的远房堂侄。
description.en: Franklin Roosevelt was a fifth cousin, once removed of Theodore Roosevelt.

relationships.source: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 两人有婚外情，于1918年被埃莉诺发现。
description.en: They had an affair, which was discovered by Eleanor in 1918.

relationships.source: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福
富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福
富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福
富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 罗斯福于1907年通过纽约州律师考试后辍学。
description.en: Roosevelt dropped out in 1907 after passing the New York bar exam.

relationships.source: 约翰·南斯·加纳
relationships.target: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

position.en: Vice President of the United States

relationships.source: 亨利·阿加德·华莱士
relationships.target: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

position.en: Vice President of the United States

relationships.source: 哈里·S·杜鲁门
relationships.target: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

position.en: Vice President of the United States

relationships.source: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福
富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 罗斯福为应对大萧条而推行了“新政”。
description.en: Roosevelt implemented the 'New Deal' to combat the Great Depression.

relationships.source: 大萧条

description.zh-cn: 经济大萧条是罗斯福新政出台的直接原因。
description.en: The Great Depression was the direct cause for the implementation of the New Deal.

relationships.source: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 作为二战同盟国领袖，两人建立了密切的合作关系和个人友谊。
description.en: As leaders of the Allied powers in WWII, they formed a close working relationship and personal friendship.

relationships.source: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 作为二战同盟国领袖，罗斯福与斯大林始终保持友好关系。
description.en: As an Allied leader in WWII, Roosevelt maintained friendly relations with Stalin.

relationships.source: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 在第二次世界大战中，罗斯福领导的美国与希特勒领导的纳粹德国是敌对国。
description.en: During World War II, the United States led by Roosevelt was at war with Nazi Germany led by Hitler.

relationships.source: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 罗斯福在1932年美国总统选举中击败了时任总统胡佛。
description.en: Roosevelt defeated the incumbent president Hoover in the 1932 U.S. presidential election.

relationships.source: 租借法案
relationships.target: 同盟国 (第二次世界大战)

description.zh-cn: 该法案授权美国向英国、中华民国、苏联等同盟国提供战争物资。
description.en: The act authorized the U.S. to provide war materials to Allied nations like Britain, China, and the Soviet Union.

relationships.source: 珍珠港事件

description.zh-cn: 珍珠港事件直接导致美国向日本宣战，正式加入第二次世界大战。
description.en: The attack on Pearl Harbor directly led to the U.S. declaration of war against Japan and its formal entry into World War II.

relationships.source: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 罗斯福与丘吉尔、斯大林一同出席雅尔塔会议，商讨战后世界秩序。
description.en: Roosevelt attended the Yalta Conference with Churchill and Stalin to discuss the post-war world order.

relationships.source: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福
富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 罗斯福与丘吉尔、蒋中正一同出席开罗会议。
description.en: Roosevelt attended the Cairo Conference with Churchill and Chiang Kai-shek.

relationships.source: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福

description.zh-cn: 罗斯福对战后世界秩序的构想中包括成立联合国，并发挥了关键作用。
description.en: Roosevelt's vision for the post-war world included the creation of the United Nations, in which he played a key role.
